TOOLBAR_FLASH.description: Option in the Help Menu which opens a dialog that helps you flash micropython to specific boards

FLASH_SELECT_BOARD.description: Dialog asking the user to select the board he wishes to flash

FLASH_ESP.description: Dialog where the user can flash an ESP Board

FLASH_MICROBIT.description: Dialog where the user can flash a Micro:bit Board

START.description: A button that starts a process

BACK.description: A button that returns to another dialog

CANCEL.description: A button that cancels the current action

SELECT.description: A button that submits the action

FLASH_CANCEL_DIALOG.description: Dialog asking the user if he's sure he wants to cancel.

FLASH_CANCEL_TEXT_QUESTION.message: Are you sure you want to cancel?
FLASH_CANCEL_TEXT_QUESTION.description: The question of the cancel dialog.

FLASH_CANCEL_TEXT.message: The board will be unusable until you flash it.
FLASH_CANCEL_TEXT.description: A warning for the user that his board will be unusable.

FLASH_SELECT_DEVICE.description: Message saying the user to select a device to flash

FLASH_WRITING_PROGRESS.description: A message indicating the writing progress

FLASH_CONNECTING_TEXT.description: A message indicating the device is connecting

FLASH_INITIALIZING_TEXT.description: A message indicating the device is initializing

FLASH_UNKNOWN_BOARD_TEXT.description: A message indicating the device is an unknown board

FLASH_ERASING_DEVICE_TEXT.description: A message indicating the device is erasing

FLASH_COMPLETE_TEXT.description: A message indicating the device has been flashed

FLASH_DISCONNECTING_TEXT.description: A message indicating the device is disconnecting

FLASH_ERROR_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND.message: Error: Device not found, please try again.
FLASH_ERROR_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND.description: A message indicating the device was not found
